abstract.p: In a portable cutting tool configured to perform a cutting operation through movement along the upper surface of a workpiece, when an ordinary inner rotor type motor is used as the drive source, the motor is rotated at high speed to obtain a high output, which is reduced in speed by a speed reduction device to thereby secure an appropriate rotational speed for a rotary cutter. Since the electric motor is rotated at high speed in this construction, there have been problems of noise, vibration, etc. The present invention aims to achieve a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

A direct drive system is incorporated with an outer rotor type electric motor (11) used as the drive source and with a rotary cutter (12) directly mounted to an output shaft (11d) of the motor, and the electric motor (11) is rotated at an appropriate rotational speed for the rotary cutter (12), for example, at approximately 6,000 RPM, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool 1.

description.heading: TECHNICAL FIELD
description.p: The present invention relates to a cutting tool using a so-called outer rotor type electric motor as the drive source.
description.heading: BACKGROUND ART
description.p: The patent document mentioned below discloses a technique related to a cutting tool using an inner rotor type brushless motor as the drive source. The inner rotor type brushless motor has, on the inner side of the motor, a rotor including permanent magnets (magnets) including N-poles and S-poles, and, on the outer side of the motor, a stator constituted by a three-phase stator winding.

In contrast to the inner rotor type brushless motor, the outer rotor type brushless motor has, on the outer side of the motor, a rotor including permanents magnet including N-poles and S-poles, and, on the inner side of the motor, a stator constituted by a three-phase stator winding.

Assuming that their motors including the rotor and the stator are of the same size, comparison of the outer rotor type brushless motor and the inner rotor type brushless motor shows that the outer rotor type brushless motor can provide a larger torque since the magnets mounted to the outer rotor may have a larger surface area than those mounted to the inner rotor.

Thus, the outer rotor type brushless motor may be reduced in size as compared with the inner rotor type one without accompanying an increase in size (i.e., with the torque remaining the same); otherwise, the outer rotor type brushless motor may provide lower rotation-higher torque as compared with the inner rotor type one if no reduction in size is effected and they are of equivalent size.

description.heading: SUMMARY OF THE INVENTION
PROBLEMS TO BE SOLVED BY THE INVENTION
description.p: While there has been a demand for a further enhancement in the power of cutting tools on the market, the conventional cutting tool has been enabled to provide the requisite output by employing a motor of high rotation-low torque, and has been adjusted so as to provide suitable rotation of a cutter and torque for cutting by utilizing a speed reduction mechanism.
However, employing a motor of higher rotation may cause problems such as an increase in the wind noise and vibration of the motor itself.

It is an object of the present invention to achieve both an enhancement in motor power and a reduction in the wind noise and vibration of the motor itself by mounting an outer rotor type brushless motor that can be set to low rotation-high torque without accompanying an increase in the output and size of the motor as compared with the inner rotor type brushless motor.
description.heading: MEANS FOR SOLVING THE PROBLEMS
description.p: The above problem can be solved by the invention as described below.

According to a first aspect of the invention, a cutting tool includes a base for contacting with a workpiece, and a tool main body supported on an upper side of the base. The tool main body is provided with an outer rotor type electric motor as a drive source for rotating a rotary cutter.

In the first aspect of the invention, an outer rotor type electric motor is provided as the drive source, so that, as compared with the case where an inner rotor type brushless motor is used as the drive source, it is possible to for the electric motor to rotate at a lower speed with a higher torque while maintaining the output and the size thereof, whereby it is possible to achieve both an enhancement in the motor power and a reduction in the wind noise, vibration, etc. of the motor itself.

According to a second aspect of the invention, in the first aspect of the invention, the cutting tool is of a direct drive type, in which the rotary cutter is directly mounted to an output shaft of the electric motor.

In the second aspect of the invention, the rotary cutter is directly mounted to the output shaft of the electric motor due to the direct drive type, so that the rotational speed of the rotary cutter and the rotational speed of the electric motor coincide with each other. Thus, the rotational speed of the electric motor coincides with the proper rotational speed of the rotary cutter, so that it is possible for the electric motor to rotate at a low rotational speed of approximately 5,000 to 6,000, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the wind noise or vibration of mainly the cooling fan of the electric motor and eventually to realize a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

According to a third aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the second aspect of the invention, the rotational speed of the electric motor is set to 5,000 to 6,000 RPM when a diameter of the rotary cutter is between 185 mm and 190 mm.

With the third aspect of the invention, it is possible to achieve a reduction in the rotational speed of the electric motor due to the direct drive type, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

According to a fourth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the first aspect of the invention, the cutting tool is provided with a shaft displacement mechanism configured to displace a spindle having the rotary tool mounted thereto to the side of the base with respect to the output shaft of the electric motor.

With the fourth aspect of the invention, the rotation center of the rotary cutter may be set to a low position nearer to the side of the base by the shaft displacement mechanism, so that it is possible to secure a large cutting depth of the rotary cutter with respect to the workpiece.

According to a fifth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the fourth aspect of the invention, a ratio α (Rm/Rc) of the rotational speed Rm of the electric motor to the rotational speed Rc of the rotary cutter is set to be α = 0.5 to 2.0 by the shaft displacement mechanism.

With the fifth aspect of the invention, when the proper rotational speed Rc of the rotary cutter is set, for example, to 6,000 RPM, it is possible to set the rotational speed Rm of the electric motor to 3,000 to 12,000 RPM. Conventionally, when an electric motor is used as the drive source of the electric tool, it has been a normal practice to rotate it at a high rotational speed of 25,000 RPM; whereas, in the fifth aspect of the invention, it is only necessary to rotate the outer rotor type electric motor at a very low rotational speed of approximately 3,000 to 12,000 RPM, so that it is possible to achieve a reduction in the wind noise and vibration of mainly the cooling fan of the electric motor, thereby making it possible to achieve a reduction in the noise of the cutting tool.

According to a sixth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the fourth or fifth aspect of the invention, the rotational speed Rm of the electric motor and the rotational speed Rc of the rotary cutter are set to be equal to each other by the shaft displacement mechanism.

With the sixth aspect of the invention, it is possible to rotate the electric motor at a low speed as in the case of direct drive system while securing a large cutting depth of the rotary cutter with respect to the workpiece, making it possible to achieve a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

According to a seventh aspect of the invention, in the first aspect of the invention, a speed reduction device is provided for reducing the speed of the rotational output of the electric motor before outputting to a spindle to which the rotary cutter is mounted.

In recent years, there is a demand for a further enhancement in the power of cutting tools on the market; in this connection, the conventional cutting tool has provided the requisite output through an increase in motor size (an increase in motor size in the axial direction); an increase in motor size in the axial direction, however, impairs the operability of the tool. The operability may become higher as the handle portion is positioned nearer to the center of gravity of the product and nearer to the saw blade. However, an increase in the motor size in the axial direction may result that the position of the center of gravity of the product becomes away from the cutter; that is, the handle portion, provided substantially at the position corresponding to the center of gravity, is positioned away from the cutter, with the result that the operability is impaired.

The seventh aspect of the invention is aimed to achieve an increase in motor power without impairing the operability of the cutting tool by mounting an outer rotor type brushless motor that allows to achieve a reduction in motor size with the same motor output and allows a reduction in the length of the motor in the axial direction as compared with the inner rotor type brushless motor.

With the seventh aspect of the invention, the rotational output of the electric motor is transmitted to the spindle having the rotary cutter mounted thereto via the speed reduction device. As the drive source, there is used the outer rotor type electric motor, so that, as compared with the case where the inner rotor type brushless motor is used as the drive source, it is possible to achieve a reduction in the size (thickness) in the axial direction of the motor while maintaining the requisite motor output and radial size. By achieving a reduction in the thickness of the electric motor, it is possible to set the position of the center of gravity in the motor axis direction of the cutting tool and the position of the handle portion to be closer to the side of the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to improve the operability during the cutting operation; in addition, the tool may be well-balanced in weight in the motor axis direction and can be easily carried about, so that it is possible to achieve an improvement in terms of the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

Further, by employing an electric motor of approximately of the same size, it is possible to obtain a larger output than in the case of the inner rotor type motor, so that it is possible to achieve an increase in the motor power without impairing the workability of the cutting tool.

According to an eighth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the seventh aspect of the invention, the speed reduction device is configured to reduce the speed of the rotational output of the electric motor through mesh-engagement between a driving side gear and a driven side gear, or through a transmission belt stretched between a driving side pulley and a driven side pulley.

With the eighth aspect of the invention, the rotational output of the electric motor is reduced through the gear mesh-engagement type speed reduction device before being output to the spindle, or the rotational output of the electric motor is reduced through the belt transmission type speed reduction device before being output to the spindle. Due to the speed reduction device, the outer rotor type electric motor as the drive source is reduced in speed, and the rotary cutter is rotated at an appropriate rotational speed.

Further, by using a speed reduction device of this type, it is possible to displace the rotation center of the rotary cutter (spindle) downwards with respect to the output axis of the electric motor to bring it closer to the base, so that it is possible to set a larger cutting depth of the rotary cutter with respect to the work.

According to a ninth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the seventh or eighth aspect of the invention, the tool main body is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user, and the handle portion is arranged on the side of the rotary cutter with respect to a center of a width dimension in a motor axis direction of the cutting tool.

With the ninth aspect of the invention, the handle portion may be arranged at a position very close to the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to efficiently impart the operational force of the operator to the rotary cutter, thereby achieving an enhancement in the workability (operability) and in ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

According to a tenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to any one of the seventh to ninth aspects, the tool main body is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user, and wherein a distance L1 in a motor axis direction between the handle portion and the rotary cutter is set to 40 mm to 65 mm.

With the tenth aspect of the invention, the handle portion may be arranged at a position very close to the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to efficiently impart the operational force of the operator to the rotary cutter, whereby it is possible to enhance the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

The distance between the handle portion and the rotary cutter may be set within the range of 40 mm to 65 mm. By employing the outer rotor type electric motor as the drive source, it is possible to shorten the length of the electric motor, so that it is possible to set the position of the center of gravity of the cutting tool at a position closer to the rotary cutter and eventually to reduce the distance between the handle portion and the rotary cutter, thereby enhancing the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

According to an eleventh aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to any one of the seventh to tenth aspects of the invention, the tool main body is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user, and a distance L1 in a motor axis direction between the handle portion and the rotary cutter is not more than 30 percent of a diameter of the rotary cutter.

With the eleventh aspect of the invention, the position of the handle portion with respect to the motor axis direction may be arranged at a position very close to the rotary cutter in relation to the size (diameter) of the rotary cutter, whereby it is possible to enhance the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

According to a twelfth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to any one of the seventh to eleventh aspects of the invention, a ratio (H/L) of an overall height dimension H of the cutting tool to an overall width dimension L in a motor axis direction thereof is 1.1 or more.

With the twelfth aspect of the invention, the overall width dimension L in the motor axis direction of the cutting tool is smaller than the overall height dimension H thereof, so that the center of gravity position in the motor axis direction of the cutting tool is set at a position near the rotary cutter, whereby it is possible to enhance the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool in the case where the tool main body is provided with the handle portion.

According to a thirteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according any one of the seventh through twelfth aspects of the invention, the tool main body is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user, and a position of a center of gravity of the cutting tool is aligned with a position of the handle portion with respect to a motor axis direction.

With the thirteenth aspect of the invention, the position of the center of gravity with respect to the motor axis direction is aligned with the position of the handle portion, so that the cutting tool is well-balanced in weight when the user grasps the handle portion, whereby it is possible for the user to easily carry about the cutting tool and to perform the cutting operation by grasping it without having to apply any excessive force to the hand.

According to a fourteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the first aspect of the invention, a cooling fan for cooling the motor is provided on an output shaft of the electric motor.

In recent years, there is a demand for a further enhancement in power regarding the cutting tools on the market, however, as compared with the screw fastening tool, the cutting tool requires a larger load current, and therefore, the motor is prone to generate heat and is necessary to be cooled. With the fourteenth aspect of the invention, the cooling fan is mounted in addition to the use of the outer rotor type brushless motor in order to achieve both an increase in power and an improvement in terms of the durability of the motor.

With the fourteenth aspect of the invention, the rotary cutter is rotated by using the outer rotor type electric motor as the drive source. By using the outer rotor type electric motor as the drive source, it is possible to achieve a reduction in size in the motor axis direction to approximately the same degree as in the case where an inner rotor type brushless motor is used as the drive source. Since the cooling fan is accommodated for the outer rotor type electric motor, it is possible to sufficiently cool the outer rotor type electric motor of the cutting tool such as a circular saw, making it possible to stabilize the operation thereof and to achieve an improvement in terms of durability.

According to a fifteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the fourteenth aspect of the invention, a rotor of the electric motor is of a U-shaped sectional configuration with one side closed with respect to an axial direction of the output shaft closed, and the cooling fan is provided on the closed side of the rotor.

With the fifteenth aspect of the invention, regarding the mounting position in the motor axis direction of the cooling fan, the cooling fan is mounted by using as the mounting base the closed side of the cup-shaped rotor of a U-shaped sectional configuration with one side closed in the axial direction, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the thickness of the electric motor while achieving simplification in the cooling fan mounting structure and in the assembling operation.

According to a sixteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the fifteenth aspect of the invention, the cooling fan is arranged on a rear side of a stator with respect to a motor axis direction.

With the sixteenth aspect of the invention, the cooling fan may be arranged at the rear portion side of the electric motor, and an exhaust hole may be provided on the rear portion side of the electric motor. On the other hand, the handle portion to be grasped by the user is normally provided on the front portion side of the electric motor, so that it is possible to mitigate the blowing of exhaust air toward the hand of the user, whereby it is possible to enhance the workability and usability of the cutting tool.

According to a seventeenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the fifteenth aspect of the invention, the cooling fan is arranged on a front side of a stator with respect to a motor axis direction.

With the seventeenth aspect of the invention, the cooling fan may be arranged on the front portion side of the electric motor and at a position closer to the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to set the center of gravity position in the motor axis direction of the cutting tool at a portion near the rotary cutter and on the lower side the handle portion; therefore, it is possible to efficiently apply the operational force of the operator to the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to enhance the workability and operability of the cutting tool; further, the tool can be carried about with the handle portion being grasped in a well-balanced manner in terms of weight, so that it is possible to achieve an enhancement in terms of portability and ease of handling.

According to an eighteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the sixteenth or seventeenth aspect, the cutting tool is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user; the handle portion includes an uprise portion uprise upwardly from an upper portion of the electric motor, a main grip portion extending rearwards from an upper portion of the uprise portion, and a connection portion connecting a rear portion of the main grip portion to a rear portion of the electric motor; a circuit board configured to control an operation of the electric motor is accommodated within the connection portion, the connection portion is provided with an intake hole, and an air communication passage is formed to extend from the intake hole to the electric motor, so that the circuit board is cooled through rotation of the cooling fan.

With the eighteenth aspect of the invention, it is possible for the user to perform the operation of moving the cutting tool while grasping mainly the main grip portion with one hand. The connection portion of the handle portion is usually not a portion to be grasped by the user, so that it can be formed in a generally flat configuration, and therefore, there is no need to take into account the grasping property thereof, whereby a circuit board of a flat configuration such as a control circuit board can be accommodated within the connection portion.

With the eighteenth aspect of the invention, the connection portion is provided with the intake hole for introducing external air. By providing the air communication passage extending from the intake hole to the interior of the electric motor, external air is introduced into the connection portion via the intake hole through the rotation of the cooling fan, whereby it is possible to cool the circuit board. Through the cooling of the circuit board, it is possible to normally perform in stable the operation of the electric motor and eventually the operation of the cutting tool and to enhance the durability thereof. In this way, it is possible to provide the circuit board inside the connection portion of the handle portion provided at a position relatively close to the electric motor, and to cool this along with the electric motor by means of the cooling fan.

According to a nineteenth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the sixteenth or seventeenth aspect of the invention, the cutting tool is provided with a handle portion to be grasped by the user; the handle portion includes an uprise portion uprise upwardly from an upper portion of the electric motor, a main grip portion extending rearwards from an upper portion of the uprise portion, and a connection portion connecting a rear portion of the main grip portion to a rear portion of the electric motor; a circuit board configured to control an operation of the electric motor is accommodated within the uprise portion; and the uprise portion is provided with an intake hole, and an air communication passage is formed to extend from the intake hole to the electric motor, so that the circuit board is cooled through rotation of the cooling fan.

With the nineteenth aspect of the invention, it is possible to cool the circuit board for controlling the motor provided inside the uprise portion of the handle portion. Through the cooling of the circuit board, it is possible to perform in stable the operation of the electric motor and eventually the operation of the cutting tool and to enhance the durability thereof. In this way, it is possible to provide the circuit board inside the uprise portion of the handle portion provided at a position relatively close to the electric motor, and to cool this along with the electric motor by means of the cooling fan.

According to a twentieth aspect of the invention, a direct-drive type cutting tool includes a base for contacting with a workpiece, and a tool main body supported on an upper side of the base. The tool main body is provided with an electric motor configured to rotate a rotary cutter. The rotary cutter is directly mounted to an output shaft of the electric motor.

The invention according to the twentieth aspect relates to a hand-held type cutting tool called, for example, portable circular saw, and the cutting operation is performed through movement by the user while the cutting tool is placed on the workpiece. A cutting tool of this type is provided with a base for contacting with the upper surface of the workpiece, and a tool main body supported on the upper side of the base. The tool main body is provided with a circular rotary cutter (saw blade) rotated by an electric motor. The lower portion side of the rotary cutter is brought to protrude toward the lower surface side of the base, and the cutting operation is performed, with this protruding portion cutting into the workpiece.

In general, the tool main body is configured such that the rotational output of the electric motor is reduced through a gear train for speed reduction before being output to a spindle having the rotary cutter mounted thereto. A technique relating to such a gear reduction type circular saw is disclosed in Japanese Laid-Open Patent Publication No. 2010-194697. As disclosed in this document, in a cutting tool of this type, an electric motor is provided so as to protrude laterally, with the motor axis being orthogonal to the proceeding direction of the rotary cutter mounted to the spindle (the cutting proceeding direction).

In this way, in the prior art, the rotational output of the electric motor is reduced in speed through a gear-mesh type speed reduction device before being output to the spindle, so that the size of the tool in the motor axis direction (the motor length direction) (the laterally protruding dimension with respect to the cutting proceeding direction) is rather large by the dimension corresponding to the speed reduction device, making it difficult to achieve a reduction in size in this direction. The invention according to the twentieth aspect has been made in view of this problem and is aimed to achieve a reduction in the size of the tool main body in the motor axis direction.

The twentieth aspect of the invention incorporates the direct drive system (the direct connection drive system), so that it is possible to omit the speed reduction device such as the gear train, thereby achieving a reduction in size in the motor axis direction. By achieving a reduction in the size in the motor axis direction of the tool main body, it is possible to set the center of gravity position in the motor axis direction of the cutting tool at a position close to the rotary cutter; in addition, also regarding the handle portion which is normally provided on the electric motor to correspond to the gravity center position, it can be provided at a position closer to the rotary cutter. Thus, it is possible to achieve an improvement in terms of the operability of the cutting tool during the cutting operation; in addition, since the tool can be easily carried about while well-balanced in weight in the motor axis direction, it is possible to improve the workability (operability) and ease of handling (portability) of the cutting tool.

Further, due to the direct drive system, the rotary cutter is directly mounted to the output shaft of the electric motor, so that the rotational speed of the rotary cutter and the rotational speed of the electric motor coincide with each other. Thus, the rotational speed of the electric motor coincides with the proper rotational speed of the rotary cutter, so that it is possible to effect low speed rotation of, for example, approximately 5,000 to 6,000 RPM, whereby it is possible for the electric motor to achieve a reduction mainly in the wind noise or the vibration of the cooling fan and eventually a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

According to a twenty-first aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the twentieth aspect of the invention, the electric motor is a brushless motor. With the twenty-first aspect of the invention, it is possible to enhance ease of maintenance of the electric motor, and to easily perform the operational control on the rotational speed, etc. thereof.

According to a twenty-second aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the twenty-first aspect of the invention, the electric motor is an outer rotor type brushless motor. With the third aspect of the invention, an outer rotor type brushless motor is provided as the drive source, so that, as compared with the case where an inner rotor type brushless motor is used as the drive source, it is possible to achieve a reduction in the speed and an enhancement in the torque of the electric motor while maintaining the output and size thereof, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the wind noise, vibration, etc. of the motor itself.

According to a twenty-third aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the twentieth aspect of the invention, a rotational speed of the electric motor is set such that a peripheral velocity of the rotary cutter is 35 to 60 m/s.

With the twenty-third aspect of the invention, due to the direct drive system, it is possible to cause the electric motor to rotate at a low speed based on an appropriate peripheral velocity of the rotary cutter, whereby it is possible to achieve a reduction in the wind noise, vibration, etc. of the motor itself.

According to a twenty-fourth aspect of the invention, in the cutting tool according to the twenty-third aspect of the invention, a diameter of the rotary cutter is 185 mm to 190 mm, and the rotational speed of the electric motor is set to 5,000 to 6,000 RPM.

With the twenty-fourth aspect of the invention, due to incorporation of the direct drive system, the rotary cutter is directly mounted to the output shaft of the electric motor, so that the rotational speed of the rotary cutter and the rotational speed of the electric motor coincide with each other. Thus, it is possible to cause the electric motor to make low speed rotation of approximately 5,000 to 6,000 RPM by using a rotary cutter having a diameter of 185 mm to 190 mm, whereby it is possible to for the electric motor to achieve a reduction mainly in the wind noise or the vibration of the cooling fan and eventurally a reduction in the noise and vibration of the cutting tool.

description.heading: MODE FOR CARRYING OUT THE INVENTION
description.p: Next, the first embodiment of the present invention will be described with reference to Figs. 1 through 6. Figs. 1 through 3 illustrate a cutting tool 1 according to the first embodiment. The cutting tool 1 is a so-called portable circular saw, and is provided with a base 2 of a flat plate configuration for contacting with the upper surface of a workpiece W, and a tool main body 10 supported on the upper side of the base 2.

The tool main body 10 is provided with an electric motor 11 as a drive source, and a circular rotary cutter 12 directly mounted to an output shaft 11 d of the electric motor 11. The lower portion side of the rotary cutter 12 protrudes from the lower surface of the base 2, and this protruding portion cuts into the workpiece W, whereby the cutting operation is performed. In the drawings, the cutting tool 1 is moved in the cutting proceeding direction indicated by the outline arrow, whereby the rotary cutter 12 is brought to cut into the workpiece. In the following description, with respect to the forward and rearward direction of the components or of the structures, the direction in which the cutting operation proceeds will be referred to as the front side or the front portion, and the side opposite the same will be referred to as the rear side or the rear portion. However, regarding the electric motor 11, the side of the rotary cutter 12 with respect to the motor axis direction J will be referred to as the front side or the front portion, and the side opposite the same will be referred to as the rear side or the rear portion.

As shown in Fig. 3, as the electric motor 11, there is employed an electric motor which is a brushless motor and which is a so-called outer rotor type motor. This electric motor 11 is provided with a rotor 11c rotatably supported on the outer peripheral side of a stator 11b that is fixed in position within a motor case 11a. An output shaft 11d is mounted to the rotor 11c. The output shaft 11d is rotatably supported via bearings 11f and 11g. The rear side bearing 11f is mounted to the rear portion of the motor case 11a, and the front side bearing 11g is mounted to a motor mounting base portion 14b provided on the backside of a blade case 14.

A cooling fan 11e for cooling the motor is mounted to the rear portion of the output shaft 11d. A number of exhaust holes (air windows) 11h are provided in the rear portion of the motor case 11a at positions around the cooling fan 11e. On the other hand, as shown in Fig. 2, intake holes 14c are provided in the rear surface of the motor mounting base portion 14b. Further, in the cutting tool 100 according to the fourth embodiment, there is provided the outer rotor type electric motor 111 as the drive source, so that it possible for its machine length L0 to be smaller (thinner) as compared with that in the case where the inner rotor type electric motor is used as the drive source. Further, since the handle portion 130 is arranged at a position closer to the rotary cutter 112, a force of pushing the cutting tool 100 in the cutting proceeding direction can be efficiently applied to the rotary cutter 112, whereby it is possible to reduce the burden on the hand of the user, thereby enhancing the operability or workability of the cutting tool 100. In particular, in the case of the fourth embodiment, with the cutting depth of the rotary cutter 112 being set to maximum, the ratio of the overall width dimension H between the apex of the handle portion 130 and the lower end portion of the movable cover 116 to the overall width dimension L in the motor axis J direction, (H/L), is set to approximately 1.6, so that the overall width dimension L in the motor axis J direction is set to be very small with respect to the overall height dimension H, whereby the cutting tool 100 is made compact in the motor axis J direction. As shown in Fig. 20, as the electric motor 311, there is employed an electric motor which is a brushless motor and which is a so-called outer rotor type motor. In general, the outer rotor type brushless motor has, on the outer side of the motor, a rotor including permanent magnets including N-poles and S-poles, and, on the inner side of the motor, a stator constituted by a three-phase stator winding. In contrast, the ordinary inner rotor type brushless motor, which has a stator on the outer peripheral side of the motor, has, on the inner side of the motor, a rotor including permanent magnets including N-poles and S-poles, and, on the inner side of the motor, a stator constituted by a three-phase stator winding.

Here, when comparison is made between an outer rotor type brushless motor and an inner rotor type brushless motor which are of the same motor size inclusive of the rotor and the stator, the magnets mounted to the outer rotor may have a larger surface area than the magnets mounted to the inner rotor, so that it is possible for the outer rotor type brushless motor to provide a larger torque. For this reason, the outer rotor type brushless motor may be reduced in size as compared with the inner rotor type brushless motor without accompanying an increase in torque (i.e., with the torque remaining the same); otherwise, the outer rotor type brushless motor may provide lower rotation-higher torque as compared with the inner rotor type one if no reduction in size is effected and they are of equivalent size.

Thus, it is possible to achieve a reduction in the size in the motor axis J direction of the tool main body 310 by an amount corresponding to the speed reduction mechanism, so that it is possible to set the gravity center position in the same direction and the position of the handle portion 330 to positions nearer to the side of the rotary cutter 312, whereby it is possible to enhance the operability, etc. of the cutting tool 307.

Further, while the above-described embodiments incorporate the direct drive system, in which the rotary cutter 312 is directly mounted to the output shaft 311d (342, 354, 364) of the electric motor 311 (340, 350, 360), the term "direct drive system" in the present invention means a system in which no speed changing means such as a speed reduction gear train is interposed; thus, the term also covers a construction in which the rotary cutter is mounted to a shaft (cutter shaft) which is physically separated from the output shaft of the electric motor but which is coaxial with the output shaft of the electric motor and integrated therewith in terms of rotation to rotate at the same rotational speed as the output shaft.
